item.title: Quick Tutorial: Setting up ECS with Terraform
item.description: This document describes, for the AWS ECS noob, how to set up an AWS ECS cluster from scratch, entirely using Terraform. If you’re in a hurry, skip to the end to just get a module you can copy-and-paste. Terraform is a tool that lets you declaratively describe the state of your infrastructure. Probably the best feature about it is that your infra’s state is in version control, instead of ad-hoc scripts and here-be-dragons resources that somebody made by clicking around in the AWS UI.
